(void) + initialize [implementation]

Detailed Description

A CPToolbar is displayed at the top of a window with multiple buttons (tools) that offer the user quick access to features.

Delegate Methods

-(CPArray)toolbarDefaultItemIdentifiers:(CPToolbar)toolbar; Called to obtain the toolbar's default item identifiers. Required.

Parameters:
toolbar the toolbar to obtain identifiers for
Returns:
an array of default item identifiers in the order on the toolbar

-(CPArray)toolbarAllowedItemIdentifiers:(CPToolbar)toolbar; Called to obtain the toolbar's default item identifiers. Required.

Parameters:
toolbar the toolbar to obtain identifiers for
Returns:
an array of default item identifiers in the order on the toolbar

- (CPToolbarItem)toolbar:(CPToolbar)toolbar itemForItemIdentifier:(CPString)itemIdentifier willBeInsertedIntoToolbar:(BOOL)flag; Called to obtain a toolbar item. Required.

Parameters:
toolbar the toolbar the item belongs to
itemIdentifier the identifier of the toolbar item
flag YES means the item will be placed in the toolbar. NO means the item will be displayed for some other purpose (non-functional)
Returns:
the toolbar item or nil if no such item belongs in the toolbar

00441     {
00442         _identifier = [aCoder decodeObjectForKey:CPToolbarIdentifierKey];

00444         _showsBaselineSeparator = [aCoder decodeBoolForKey:CPToolbarShowsBaselineSeparatorKey];

00447

00449         _defaultItems = [aCoder decodeObjectForKey:CPToolbarDefaultItemsKey];
00450         _allowedItems = [aCoder decodeObjectForKey:CPToolbarAllowedItemsKey];
00451         _selectableItems = [aCoder decodeObjectForKey:CPToolbarSelectableItemsKey];

00453         [[_identifiedItems allValues] makeObjectsPerformSelector:@selector(_setToolbar:) withObject:self];
00454 
00455         _items = [];

00458 
00459         // This won't come from a Cib, but can come from manual encoding.
00460         [self setDelegate:[aCoder decodeObjectForKey:CPToolbarDelegateKey]];
00461 
00462         // Because we don't know if a delegate will be set later (it is optional
00463         // as of OS X 10.5), we need to call -_reloadToolbarItems here.
00464         // In order to load any toolbar items that may have been configured in the
00465         // Cib. Unfortunatelly this means that if there is a delegate
00466         // specified, it will be read later and the resulting call to -setDelegate:
00467         // will cause -_reloadToolbarItems] to run again :-(
00468         // FIXME: Can we make this better?
00469         [self _reloadToolbarItems];
00470     }
00471 
00472     return self;
00473 }

- (void) toolbarItemDidChange: (CPToolbarItem)  anItem   [implementation]

Notifies the toolbar that an item has been changed. This will cause the toolbar to reload its items.

Parameters:
anItem the item that has been changed

Definition at line 394 of file CPToolbar.j.

00399     var index = 0,
00400         count = [_items count];
00401

00413     }
